title: identification with narrative roles important for game enjoyment
content: ''the findings support the importance of narrative elements for successful computer games. A major part of the fun of playing comes out of identification processes that root back in the narrative framework of the game. If only a rudimentary background plot is available, the character or role that players could identify with may remain underdeveloped, which would result in lowered game enjoyment. Thus, the inclusion of rich narrative content is both a challenge for game development, but also an important advantage for the entertainment experience''

title: Immersive Experience Questionnaire (IEQ)
content:
31 items (partially reverse scored) on 7-point scale (1=not at all / very little, 7=a lot / very much so)

single question measure of immersion

5 immersion factors: 
- challenge
- control
- real world dissociation
- emotional involvement
- cognitive involvement

45 items total, 7-point Likert scale (1=not at all true, 4=somewhat true, 7=very true)

- perceived competence
- effort/importance
- pressure/tension
- perceived choice
- value/usefulness
- relatedness

title: link of sound and presence has been investigated
content: > "A number of studies have investigated how the relative presence of sound may influence user ratings of presence. Manipulations of this feature include the presence or absence of all sound, ambient sound, diegetic sound, or spatialized sound, as well as the number of sound channels used."

importance for presence: technological immersion > sound quality > image quality

title: self-determination theory
content:
self-determination theory, which describes humans as trying to satisfy three psychological needs: 
- autonomy,
- competence, and 
- relatedness. 

When these needs are met, individuals experience enjoyment.

title: importance of sound effects as feedback
content:
designing for fun

``satisfying sounds''

``Satisfying sounds are a vital addition
for games, and helpful for alerting, such
as a ringing phone. Sound design
requires skill, but suitable sound effects
give effective feedback and are well liked
by users. However, users want control
over the sound, especially the capacity to
turn it off. The market in custom ring
tones for cell phones is way beyond what
can be justified by necessity—it must be
fun to have your own ring tone''
